FuncDef: The display ospf router-id conflict command displays information about router ID conflicts (if any).

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an OSPF process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Examples: Detect Result       : A router ID conflict may halt between two remote devices.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If router ID conflicts exist on the network and are not resolved automatically, route flapping may occur. To check information about router ID conflicts (if any), run the display ospf router-id conflict command. The command output helps with the check on incorrect configurations.
Precautions
The obtained router ID conflicts do not necessarily exist on the network.The command displays information about the router ID conflicts only between two devices.
